resources.string: The main hub of the music app. Access all the different screens from this page. Each Page links to a new Activity page, and adversally, each activity links back to this first page and occasionally some of the other choices.

Displays the title and artist of the currently playing song. The star icon will add a song to the favourites list, and the Playlist icon will open a Spinner menu to either give the user the option to add it to a Playlist which they can also name with (EditTExt), or add it to an existing Playlist.

Initially empty, when the user creates playlists from songs, they will appear here. If selecting a playlist, will display a Spinner menu that will offer to rename Playlist(EditText), or delete the playlist Array.remove(). If the playlist is selected, when the user clicks the Playlist button, the selected playlist will appear there.

Search for your favourite artists using an (EditText) which opens a new Intent activity to search various online music stores to find the best fit for the search. Any favourited songs will display other songs from your library by the same artists below.

If a Playlist has been selected in the Playlist activity, the name and songs selected will appear, otherwise it will show all of the users songs in alphabetical order. The ScrollView center box will be created using a ListView and ArrayAdapter to accommodate how big or small a collection of songs the user has. To add a new song to the library, the playlist icon button will call an Intent that will link to the users music account, such as the Deezer API or another user music database. To select a song to play, it will open an actionBar that will allow the user to either play the song and move to the NowPlaying activity, or remove the song from the playlist using an textArray.remove() function.
Recommended songs, based on songs that have been favourited by user
